p: The invasion of bacteria like S. p. in IAV infected hosts is linked to increased death rates during pandemic outbreaks, such as the 1918 “Spanish Flu”, where pneumococcus was found in samples collected from infected individuals [ 53– 56]. Coinfections also occur during seasonal influenza epidemics to varying degrees [ 34, 57]. Previous reports show that pro-inflammatory cytokines, such as TNF-α, IL-6, and type I IFN, increase during coinfection [ 21, 22]. IL-6 and type I IFN display detrimental effects but TNF-α is protective during coinfection [ 21, 22]. Thus, an improved understanding of the role for various cytokines and immune cells during coinfection is needed to understand this disease.
